headline.main: BOOK EXCHANGE; The New York Times makes an earnest effort to keep its advertising columns free of deceptive and dishonest announcements. Readers are requested to report unsatisfactory dealings with any advertiser. BOOK EXCHANGE

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, May 24.--The courts today ordered the immediate deportation from Uruguay of more than one hundred members of an in ternational white-slave gang which has been trying to settle in Uruguay ...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, May 24.--The courts today ordered the immediate deportation from Uruguay of more than one hundred members of an in ternational white-slave gang which has been trying to settle in Uruguay ...

headline.main: WHITE SLAVERS LOSE ON APPEAL IN URUGUAY; High Court Orders Immediate Deportation of More Than 100 Driven From Argentina.

docs.snippet: THE gentleman from Lima, Peru, was idly turning the pages of El Comercio, the daily newspaper of his home city. It seemed a good opportunity to  find out something about the sporting proclivities of the citizens of Peru. What is the favorite game...
docs.lead_paragraph: THE gentleman from Lima, Peru, was idly turning the pages of El Comercio, the daily newspaper of his home city. It seemed a good opportunity to find out something about the sporting proclivities of the citizens of Peru. What is the favorite game down there?

headline.main: Sports of the Times; The Gentleman From Peru Baseball in Peru. Another Subject Dropped. The Big Racing Day. Closing Remarks.

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, May 26.--The troublesome tariff question is again looming as a spectre, threatening both the Pan-American commercial conference at Washington in October and the general Pan-American conference in Montevideo next May.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, May 26.--The troublesome tariff question is again looming as a spectre, threatening both the Pan-American commercial conference at Washington in October and the general Pan-American conference in Montevideo next May.
docs.abstract: Rev of customs issue; Chile takes lead in attempt to bring it up at confs; project drawn up for regional agreement by Argentina, Uruguay, Bolivia, Paraguay, and Chile

headline.main: LATINS AGAIN MOVE TO DISCUSS TARIFF; Chile Takes Lead in Drive to Bring Question Before Two Pan-American Parleys. CUSTOMS UNION IS PUSHED Santiago Spokesman Would Be Willing to include the United Statesand Canada in the Project. Chile Aggressive on Tariffs. Many Barriers to Union.

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES
